article:
'Polyethoxylated [[tallow]] amine' ('POEA') is a surfactant that enhances the
activity of herbicides. The role of a surfactant in a herbicide product is to
improve wettablility of the hydrophobic surface of plants for maximum coverage
and aid penetration through the plant surface. http://www.epa.gov/espp/litstatus/effects/redleg-
frog/glyphosate/appendix-b.pdf U.S. Patent 4,528,023

A review of the literature provided to the EPA in 1997 found that POEA was more
toxic to fish than glyphosate http://www.fs.fed.us/foresthealth/pesticide/p-
dfs/Surfactants.pdf
